result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Steven Diebitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary.
Absolute sobriety.
No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
Random urine screens.
Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment.

miscConds.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
No driving a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Pay fine in the amount of 
$2400.00 plus all court costs
Pay restitution in the amount of $500.00 to Robert F.  Restitution to be paid first
Pay DNA surcharges;
Provide a DNA sample.
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash Bail to apply
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

timeConds.notes: 9 months in the House of Correction with 143 days credit with huber for work and treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Steven Diebitz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA AND SENTENCING Transcript (23 pages) commencing 11-16-2015 received and filed. CH
Restitution Refund Packets

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS with 143 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.
Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.
  Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 9 months in the House of Correction with 143 days credit with huber for work and treatment
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- absolute sobriety
- No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs
- Random urine screens
- Seek and maintain full-time employment
- no driving a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
- Provide a DNA sample
- Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 3 years with the mandatory reinstatement fee.  

Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of 3 years thereafter.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Pay fine in the amount of $2400.00 plus all court costs
Pay restitution in the amount of $500.00 to Robert F.  Restitution to be paid first
Pay DNA surcharges;
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash Bail to apply
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Victim Impact Statement

Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.

Defendant Robert Steven Diebitz in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Defendant Robert Steven Diebitz in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.  As to Count 2:  Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the State Court dismissed and read in the charge.

Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley in court, defendant Robert Steven Diebitz not in court, in custody.  Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  No motions filed.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS report discharging defendant from the program, received and filed
WCS Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Positive breath test. Parties instructed to report to Branch 22 immediately for bail review.

Court raises cash bail to $2,250 ($1,750 posted, $1,500 remains due).  Court orders that should defendant post bail he would be turned over to WCS with private pay SCRAM monitoring, in addition to all previously ordered conditions.

Defendant Robert Steven Diebitz in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court to address WCS violation- positive breath test.  Court admonishes the defendant, and raises cash bail.  Case remains calendared in Branch 19 for motion hearing on 09/29/2015 at 1:30pm.

Defendant Robert Steven Diebitz in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Motion hearing, however defense requests more time.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

15RM026049  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/27/2015
For reasons stated on the record, the Court raises cash bail to $1,750 ($1,500 previously posted, $250 remains due).  All other conditions of bail previously set remain.

Defendant Robert Steven Diebitz in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court to address WCS violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, and raises cash bail.  Case remains calendared for motion hearing on 07/02/2015 in Branch 22.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.  Court not in session, no action taken pending defendant's drug test today.
WCS Pretrial Services Violation Report (refusal) received and filed. Court does not take action at this time.

Defendant Robert Steven Diebitz in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a date for a motion hearing. Parties agreed that the defense would file their motion regarding illegal entry into the home by 06/01/2015.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Intoxicated Driver  Intervention Program Report received and filed.

Defendant Robert Steven Diebitz in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Charles Clark-West Allis Police Department.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report dated 4/10/15.
css

Defendant Robert Steven Diebitz in court.  David John Behm for Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant informs the court that he has not yet retained counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel and Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention report, received and filed.

15RM015694  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03/24/2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests, portable breathalyzers and SCRAM. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Robert Steven Diebitz in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Robert Steven Diebitz in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY to Count 2. DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT AND DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
